title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of coin using variables. The number of dimes is three more than three times the number of quarters, which you can represent as $$3+3q$$, and you can represent quarters simply as q.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the number of each coin type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their monetary values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{0.1}\left(3+3q\right)+0.25q=11.30$$.

title: Substitution
text: Plug q into the original relationship between the coins to find $$d$$.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is $$63$$ dimes and $$20$$ quarters.
